intro: Sebaea minutissima, commonly known as the dwarf sebaea, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features delicate, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, woodland habitats. Due to its small size and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
